description: Don't throw away your kale stems, save them to make this warming winter soup that features zingy lemon, parmesan, broccoli and baby spinach.
keywords: Soup,Pescatarian,Low saturated fat,Seafood free,Bonus,Tree nut free,Egg free,Winter,Low sugar,Aug 2021,Sesame free,Potato,Halal,High protein,High fibre,Soy free,Wheat free,Vegetarian,Kale,Spinach,Peanut free
name: Kale Stem Soup Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.75 cup extra virgin olive oil (save 1/2 cup to serve)
300g broccoli, florets and stem roughly chopped
350g washed white potatoes, cut into 2cm pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 tbs oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and kale and broccoli stems, then cook, stirring, for 3 minutes or until slightly softened.

Add potato and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until potato is tender. Add stock and bring to the boil over high heat. Add broccoli florets and three-quarters of the spinach. Reduce heat to medium and cook, covered, for 5 minutes or until broccoli is tender. Remove pan from heat.

Stir in lemon juice and half the zest. Using a stick blender, carefully blend soup until smooth. Divide among bowls. Top with remaining spinach, zest and extra oil, and parmesan. Season with pepper and serve.
